content.title: Wright (Hyperabduction) Test
content.description: Provocative maneuver for thoracic outlet syndrome evaluating compression in the subcoracoid space.

technique.maneuver: Arm abducted to 180 degrees and externally rotated
technique.assessment: Monitor radial pulse and reproduction of symptoms

interpretation.specificity: Low - many normal individuals have pulse changes

content.clinical_pearl: Most useful when correlated with symptom reproduction rather than just pulse changes
content.statement: Wright (Hyperabduction) Test is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
